articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Published in Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Famous Work Published in Venezuela 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On the Fundamentals of Revolutionary Party Building" was brought out in booklet on July 9 by the Cantaclara Publishing House in Venezuela.
 The work, published on Oct. 10, Juche 81(1992), clarifies a historic lesson drawn from building socialist ruling parties, fundamental principles of the Juche-oriented revolutionary party building and the issue of strengthening internationalist unity and solidarity among the revolutionary parties.

S. Korean Pilots Go on General Strike
articles.content:
S. Korean Pilots Go on General Strike 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Asiana Pilots' Union of south Korea went on a general strike on July 17 in protest against the unreasonable attitude of the company side, according to the MBC of south Korea.
 The company side turned down the demands of the union such as better working conditions at the negotiations that lasted till July 16, talking about "an infringement upon the inviolable rights of the company".    
 Accordingly, the union went on a general strike from the midday of July 17.

Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated by OSPAAL
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated by OSPAAL 
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was laid with due ceremony before the portrait of President Kim Il Sung in the building of the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America on July 13 on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of his demise.
 Present at the ceremony were Secretary General Alfredo Leon and members of the organization, representatives of political parties from different countries, the DPRK ambassador and staff members of the embassy in Havana.    
 The participants laid a basket of flowers before the portrait of the President and paid homage to him.

Russian Preparatory Committee Formed in Moscow
articles.content:
Russian Preparatory Committee Formed in Moscow 
    Moscow, July 19 (KCNA) -- The Russian preparatory committee was formed in Moscow on July 18 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation upon the initiative of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK.
 The preparatory committee chaired by Vladimir Tolstikov, chairman of the association, consists of 13 prominent figures of political and social circles including leaders of political parties.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold multifarious functions such as celebration meeting, film show, photo exhibition and art performance on the occasion.

Message of Sympathy to Equatorial Guinean President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Equatorial Guinean President
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo in connection with the losses of human lives caused by the plane accident  in the country. 
 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the bereaved families of the dead and the people of Equatorial Guinea, the message hoped that he and the government of his country would remove the aftermath of the accident as quickly as possible and stabilize the living of the bereaved families.

Greetings between Kim Yong Nam and Arroyo
articles.content:
Greetings between Kim Yong Nam and Arroyo
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, Philippine president exchanged messages of greetings on July 12 on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further expand, the messages wished them successes in their work.

articles.title: Greetings between Foreign Ministers
articles.content:
Greetings between Foreign Ministers
    Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun and his Philippine Counterpart Alberto G. Romulo exchanged messages of greetings on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
 Messages expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would favorably develop in different fields in the future, too.
